net.nicholaswilliams.java.licensing.encryption
Interface RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
RSAKeyPairGenerator
public interface RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface

An interface for the key pair generator to make unit testing possible. This interface is only implemented by RSAKeyPairGenerator.

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Nick Williams

Method Detail

generateKeyPair

KeyPair generateKeyPair()
                        throws RSA2048NotSupportedException
Generates a key pair with RSA 2048-bit security.

Returns:
a public/private key pair.
Throws:
RSA2048NotSupportedException - if RSA or 2048-bit encryption are not supported.

saveKeyPairToFiles

void saveKeyPairToFiles(KeyPair keyPair,
                        String privateOutputFileName,
                        String publicOutputFileName,
                        char[] password)
                        throws IOException,
                               AlgorithmNotSupportedException,
                               InappropriateKeyException,
                               InappropriateKeySpecificationException
Saves the key pair specified to output files specified, encrypting both with the specified password.

Parameters:
keyPair - The key pair to save to the files specified
privateOutputFileName - The name of the file to save the encrypted private key to
publicOutputFileName - The name of the file to save the encrypted public key to
password - The password to encrypt both keys with
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the files.
AlgorithmNotSupportedException - If the encryption algorithm is not supported
InappropriateKeyException - If the public or private keys are invalid
InappropriateKeySpecificationException - If the public or private keys are invalid

saveKeyPairToFiles

void saveKeyPairToFiles(KeyPair keyPair,
                        String privateOutputFileName,
                        String publicOutputFileName,
                        char[] privatePassword,
                        char[] publicPassword)
                        throws IOException,
                               AlgorithmNotSupportedException,
                               InappropriateKeyException,
                               InappropriateKeySpecificationException
Saves the key pair specified to output files specified, encrypting each with their specified passwords.

Parameters:
keyPair - The key pair to save to the files specified
privateOutputFileName - The name of the file to save the encrypted private key to
publicOutputFileName - The name of the file to save the encrypted public key to
privatePassword - The password to encrypt the private key with
publicPassword - The password to encrypt the public key with
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs while writing to the files.
AlgorithmNotSupportedException - If the encryption algorithm is not supported
InappropriateKeyException - If the public or private keys are invalid
InappropriateKeySpecificationException - If the public or private keys are invalid

saveKeyPairToProviders

void saveKeyPairToProviders(KeyPair keyPair,
                            RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptor privateKeyProvider,
                            RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptor publicKeyProvider,
                            char[] password)
                            throws AlgorithmNotSupportedException,
                                   InappropriateKeyException,
                                   InappropriateKeySpecificationException
Saves the public and private keys specified to the respective javaFileContents fields in the provided RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptors, encrypting both with the specified password.

Parameters:
keyPair - The key pair to save
privateKeyProvider - An object describing the PrivateKeyDataProvider class to generate, and into which the generated code will be saved
publicKeyProvider - An object describing the PublicKeyDataProvider class to generate, and into which the generated code will be saved
password - The password to encrypt the keys with
Throws:
AlgorithmNotSupportedException - If the encryption algorithm is not supported
InappropriateKeyException - If the public or private keys are invalid
InappropriateKeySpecificationException - If the public or private keys are invalid

saveKeyPairToProviders

void saveKeyPairToProviders(KeyPair keyPair,
                            RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptor privateKeyProvider,
                            RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptor publicKeyProvider,
                            char[] privatePassword,
                            char[] publicPassword)
                            throws AlgorithmNotSupportedException,
                                   InappropriateKeyException,
                                   InappropriateKeySpecificationException
Saves the public and private keys specified to the respective javaFileContents fields in the provided RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptors, encrypting each with their respective passwords.

Parameters:
keyPair - The key pair to save
privateKeyProvider - An object describing the PrivateKeyDataProvider class to generate, and into which the generated code will be saved
publicKeyProvider - An object describing the PublicKeyDataProvider class to generate, and into which the generated code will be saved
privatePassword - The password to encrypt the private key with
publicPassword - The password to encrypt the public key with
Throws:
AlgorithmNotSupportedException - If the encryption algorithm is not supported
InappropriateKeyException - If the public or private keys are invalid
InappropriateKeySpecificationException - If the public or private keys are invalid

savePasswordToProvider

void savePasswordToProvider(char[] password,
                            RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptor passwordProvider)
Saves the password specified to the javaFileContents field in the provided RSAKeyPairGeneratorInterface.GeneratedClassDescriptor.

Parameters:
password - The password to save to the specified Java class
passwordProvider - An object describing the PasswordProvider class to generate, and into which the generated code will be saved
